Posts.Content:
After consultation and observation from two Dr's I had tested USG of my both breasts and the results given from the NMB Diagonistics, Serampore is hereunder:
RIGHT BREAST:
Fibrograndular complex of right breast is normal in echotexture.
Three well defined, thin-walled cystic SOLs (largest measuring 5.0 mm. x 3.0 mm.) with posterior acoustic enhancement are noted at 8 - 9 O'clock position of right breast. No internal echoes are noted within the SOL.
Skin and subcutaneous tissue are of normal thickness.
No enlarged lymph node noted in right axilla.
LEFT BREAST :
Fibrograndular complex of left breast is normal in echotexture.
Two well defined cystic SOLs are noted in 6 O'clock position of left breast; one in inferior aspect of nipple areolar complex (measuring 5.0 mm x 3.0 mm.) and another in retro-areolar region (measuring 4.0 mm. x 3.0 mm.).
Skin and subcutaneous tissue are of normal thickness.
No enlarged lymph node noted in left axilla.
IMPRESSION:-
SIMPLE CYSTS IN BOTH BREASTS.
OTHERWISE NORMAL STUDY.
SUGGEST CLINICAL CORRELATION AND FURTHER INVESTIGATIONS IF NECESSARY.
 Now my question is how shall I proceed?
Posts.Title: Complex Breast Cyst
